intro: Onosma velutina, commonly known as the silky onosma, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are usually covered in a fine, velvety down, giving it its common name. Onosma velutina is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
